description: Level 0: Explicit tool calling. The prompt names the exact tool and provides all parameters. The model only needs to format and emit a valid tool call. Tests: can the model follow explicit instructions and produce a well-formed function call?

tasks.name: Ping the MCP server
tasks.prompt: Call the `ping` tool with the message "hello from benchmark".
tasks.notes: Sanity check. Tests basic tool invocation.

tasks.name: Get authenticated user
tasks.prompt: Call the `get_authenticated_user` tool to retrieve the current user's details.
tasks.notes: No parameters needed. Tests zero-parameter tool invocation.

tasks.name: Create a project
tasks.prompt: Call the `create_project` tool with these exact parameters: name="Benchmark Test Project", description="Created during MCP benchmark testing", status="active".
tasks.notes: Tests string parameter passing. Records returned project_id for downstream tasks.

tasks.name: Create a workunit
tasks.prompt: Call the `create_workunit` tool with these exact parameters: name="Hello World", problem_statement="This is a test workunit created during the MCP benchmark.", success_criteria="The workunit exists and has the correct name.", project_id="{{project_id}}", priority="normal".

expected_params.name: Hello World
expected_params.problem_statement: This is a test workunit created during the MCP benchmark.
expected_params.success_criteria: The workunit exists and has the correct name.

tasks.notes: Tests required + optional params. project_id injected from L0-03 result.

tasks.name: Create a task in a workunit
tasks.prompt: Call the `create_task` tool with these exact parameters: workunit_id="{{workunit_id}}", title="Write unit tests", description="Add comprehensive unit tests for the authentication module.", priority="high", status="todo".

expected_params.title: Write unit tests
expected_params.description: Add comprehensive unit tests for the authentication module.

tasks.name: Get a workunit with tasks
tasks.prompt: Call the `get_workunit` tool with id="{{workunit_id}}", include_tasks=true, and include_ai_context=true.

tasks.name: Update a task status
tasks.prompt: Call the `update_task` tool with id="{{task_id}}", status="in_progress", and update_mask={"paths":["status"]}.
tasks.notes: Tests nested object parameter (update_mask). This is the hardest L0 task.

tasks.name: Save a context atom
tasks.prompt: Call the `save_context` tool with these exact parameters: workunit_id="{{workunit_id}}", atom_type="progress", title="Benchmark test completed", content="This context atom was saved as part of the MCP benchmark test suite.", importance="normal".

expected_params.title: Benchmark test completed
expected_params.content: This context atom was saved as part of the MCP benchmark test suite.

tasks.name: Search for workunits
tasks.prompt: Call the `search` tool with query="Hello World", result_types=["workunit"], and page_size=10.
tasks.notes: Tests array parameter (result_types) and integer parameter.

tasks.name: Create a knowledge asset
tasks.prompt: Call the `create_asset` tool with these exact parameters: asset_type="knowledge", name="API Documentation", description="Reference documentation for the REST API.", category="documentation", format="document", status="draft".

expected_params.name: API Documentation
expected_params.description: Reference documentation for the REST API.

tasks.name: Update a workunit status to completed
tasks.prompt: Call the `update_workunit` tool with id="{{workunit_id}}", status="completed", completion_notes="Benchmark test workunit successfully completed.", and update_mask={"paths":["status","completion_notes"]}.
tasks.notes: Tests update_mask with multiple paths and status-conditional field.
